Package com.github.hugorouillard.dataframe

Class Dataframe

java.lang.Object
com.github.hugorouillard.dataframe.Dataframe
public class Dataframe extends Object
Represents a dataframe structure containing multiple series of data.

  • Constructor Details

    • Dataframe

      public Dataframe(String[] labels, Object... input_series)
      Constructs a Dataframe from variable arguments where each argument represents a column of data. Columns are labelled by the labels array.
      Parameters:
      labels - array of string, corresponding to each column label. If empty it uses default labels = 1,2,3...
      input_series - Set of multiple array that will be used as column in the Dataframe
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if labels length does not correspond to the amount of series.

    • Dataframe

      public Dataframe(String csv_file, char delimiter) throws IOException
      Constructs a Dataframe by reading data from a CSV file. The first row of the CSV file is treated as column labels. Subsequent rows are treated as data values for each column.
      Parameters:
      csv_file - Path to the CSV file to read
      delimiter - Character used as field delimiter in the CSV file
      Throws:
      IOException - If there's an error reading the file
      IllegalArgumentException - If the CSV file is empty or improperly formatted

    • selectRows

      public Dataframe selectRows(int... indices)
      Returns a new Dataframe containing only the specified rows (by index). Mimics Pandas' df.iloc[[i1, i2, ...]].
      Parameters:
      indices - the exact row indices to include
      Returns:
      a new Dataframe with those rows
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any index is out of bounds

    • selectRowsRange

      public Dataframe selectRowsRange(int from, int to)
      Returns a new Dataframe containing only the specified rows (by range). Mimics Pandas' df.iloc[from:to]
      Parameters:
      from - the starting index (included)
      to - the end index (excluded)
      Returns:
      a new Dataframe with those rows
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the range is invalid

    • selectColumns

      public Dataframe selectColumns(String... labels)
      Returns a new Dataframe containing only the specified columns (by labels). Mimics Pandas' df[["col1", "col2", ...]]
      Parameters:
      labels - the labels of the columns to include
      Returns:
      a new Dataframe with those columns
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any label is not found

    • filterRows

      public Dataframe filterRows(String columnLabel, Predicate<Object> condition)
      Returns a new Dataframe containing only the rows for which the given predicate evaluates to true, based on the values in a specified column.

      This method provides a flexible way to perform advanced filtering, similar to Pandas' conditional selection (e.g., df[df["col"] > 10]). The user is responsible for ensuring that the predicate correctly handles the type of the column's values.

      Example usage: 

      
     Dataframe df = ...;
     Dataframe filtered = df.filterRows("Age", value -> ((Integer) value) > 30);
      Parameters:
      columnLabel - The label of the column to use for filtering.
      condition - A predicate that takes a column value and returns true if the corresponding row should be kept.
      Returns:
      A new Dataframe containing only the rows where the condition is true.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified column does not exist.

    • describe

      public void describe()
      Generates descriptive statistics for the dataframe. This method computes various statistics for each numerical column in the dataframe.
